summary: The 'Amplifying Processing of Livestock in the United States Act' (A-PLUS Act) directs the Secretary of Agriculture to amend regulations to allow livestock auction owners to have an ownership interest in small meatpacking businesses. It clarifies that market agencies can own, finance, or manage packers with specified daily or annual slaughter capacities. These agencies must disclose such relationships to livestock sellers. The bill does not limit the Secretary's authority regarding the Packers and Stockyards Act.
